TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

Docs.summary: Represents a key identifier clause that identifies a security tokens specified in the security header of the SOAP message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> does not need to be used, other than when a custom security token service is created. When a security token service returns a security token, the issued security token contains references to attached and unattached security tokens Attached references refer to security tokens that are contained within the security header of the SOAP message and unattached references are security tokens that are not included within the security header of the SOAP message. These references typically affirm the authenticity of the issued security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> key identifier is placed within an `<SecurityTokenReference>` element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) does not support the creation of implied derived key identifiers. However, WCF will process and consume an incoming SOAP message with implied derived key identifiers.

Docs.returns: if is of type and the values of the and properties match the current instance; otherwise, . See the remarks for more details.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A match on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property occurs when one of the following happens:
- The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property for the instance represented by the `keyIdentifierClause` parameter is `null`.
- The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property for the current instance is `null`.
- The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property for the two instances are identical.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A match on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property occurs when one of the following happens:
- The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> propertyfor the current instance is `null`.
- The value of the `ownerType` parameter is `null`.
- The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> property is identical to the `ownerType` parameter for the current method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.ToString%2A> method returns a string that contains the values of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.LocalId%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause.OwnerType%2A> properties.
